author: Staff Reporter
text:
Issue raised in Maharashtra Council; MLCs demand arrest of Ganesh Pandey.

Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday announced that the Maharashtra Women’s Commission will hold an inquiry in the alleged case of molestation involving Ganesh Pandey, suspended president of the BJP’s youth wing. A woman activist of the party had accused him of molesting her during an event in Mathura.

The BJP too has formed an internal committee to probe the case. The party’s Maharashtra chief Raosaheb Danve has announced a three member-committee, consisting of Shobhatai Fadnavis, Manisha Chaoudhari and Smita Wagh.

Both announcements were made on Tuesday evening after the issue was raised in the State Council through an adjournment motion by Congress MLC Dipti Chaodhari. During the discussion, Chairman Ramraje Naik-Nimbalkar directed the State government to conduct an in-camera recording of the victim’s statement.

Arrest sought

All party MLCs, including those from the Shiv Sena, slammed the BJP and demanded the immediate arrest of Mr. Pandey. Leader of the Opposition Dhananjay Munde claimed that the BJP activists had threatened the party’s women workers who were protesting against the incident. “Instead of waiting for the victim to come forward, the State should have filed a suo moto complaint to initiate action,” said Vidya Chavan of the NCP.
title: Fadnavis orders probe into molestation of BJP activist
